intro: Corydalis ramosa var. glauca, commonly known as bluebell corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, blue to purple flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant features slender, branching stems and trifoliate leaves, with each leaflet being ovate to elliptic in shape. It thrives in woodland or shaded environments, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and shady borders.
